title: How many types of government has the UK had throughout history? - Quora

response.answer_text: Since 1707, the UK has been a constitutional monarchy. This existed from the 1688 Bill of Rights, which was signed by King William and Queen Mary and applied to both England and Scotland (when they were independent kingdoms). England and Scotland before 1707 had powerful monarchs, both balanced by parliaments which allow law-making and tax-raising. IN England’s case, this existed from the 13th century. Before then, the king was assisted by his nobles and formed royal councils where they would discuss matters of state and make laws. The Anglo-Saxons, Normans and Plantagenets, all had this format.
